1.title: Haught Mess
1.plot: Season 4 premiere. Richard and Hester Bynns are on a rare vacation to Napa to take in the sights and of course, taste the wine at a new vineyard. Things go awry when the experience doesn't measure up to expectations, but it's not the wine.

2.title: Em-Bare-Assed
2.plot: Give those kids in the A/V club a little authority and the power can go right to their head. One kid even thinks he can re-write history.

3.title: Press the Flesh
3.plot: A family that doesn't get along comes together for their father's wake. The family's troubles are amplified through a stranger's eyes.

4.title: Von Trapped
4.plot: Community theater boasts a tight-knit community and offers the ability to express yourself, but the pay is notoriously low. When your life is tossed into the air, it's important to get priorities straight and focus on what's most important.

5.title: Pay for Play
5.plot: Contracts can vary wildly, even inside the same company. It's up to you to negotiate the deal that best fits your lifestyle, but first, you need to know what's out there.

6.title: Behind the Teen Door
6.plot: When parents of a teen boy find a pile of loot in his bedroom, it raises a lot of questions and speculation abounds.

7.title: Trap-Ease
7.plot: Circus performers are just like anyone else, except that they do remarkable work every show. Although stage fright is a normal thing, you don't want to get so carried away that you start questioning all of your life choices.

8.title: Time Shared
8.plot: Timeshare sales are high-pressure unless you've done it before and know the tricks. Rather then sweating the details, the time can be spent comfortably reminiscing about the events that brought you here.

9.title: Poller Shift
9.plot: Strong leaders will always clash, even if it's only junior high school. Even when it looks like you're beat you have several options, depending on how much you want it, but the race isn't run until the voting is done.

10.title: Art Upstart
10.plot: It's a big day for Margarite. She's getting her first gallery opening and her mentor/gallery owner is seeing greatness, and dollar signs.

11.title: Weenie Roast
11.plot: A community cook-out brings all the characters in town and when people start talking, nothing stays secret for long. If you dance too close to the fire, you're going to get burned.

12.title: Jocko's Tops
12.plot: The career of an online influencer is a fickle one. Balancing the public's unquenchable thirst for content and your own personal search for meaning is a near impossible task. Having a dedicated team makes all the difference.

13.title: Retirement Plan
13.plot: Brothers plan their father's 60th birthday party, but they have suspicions that he's not as decrepit as he lets on.

14.title: Let It Slide
14.plot: Every married man knows that you are going to fight sometimes. The trick is admitting when you're wrong, or you can just let it slide and see what happens.

15.title: Lowe Expectations
15.plot: Terrance Bigbee is working on his anger issues with his counselor Mr. Lowe, but there is doubt as to how much of the message is really getting through.

16.title: In-House Cure
16.plot: A couple stays behind at a remote mountain cabin to work out their break-up, but take so long that they become snowed in and have bigger problems to deal with.

17.title: Compound Interests
17.plot: Camp counselors are more than activity directors, they have the opportunity to shape the lives of the youth who spend their summer at the compound, if they can agree on the most useful skills, that is.

18.title: Immigrant Song
18.plot: After a long separation, two friends, a tech star and a Latvian immigrant, come together at a 4th of July festival and are reminded of the opportunities they both enjoy.

19.title: Bull Economy
19.plot: Two sons of influence have very different approaches to life, their education. and international relations.

20.title: By Felicia
20.plot: Good friends enjoy the offerings at the State fair and the topic turns to ex-girlfriends as they ponder the opportunities missed by impatient youth.

1.title: Arms Race
1.plot: Jimmy has taken hostages because he wants to be heard and a police negotiator named Harrison has come to talk him down.

2.title: Lifesaver
2.plot: The stable boy goes to prison for a drunk driving accident to save the boss's wealthy son from a criminal record. Now he's out and drugs and alcohol are on the verge of destroying his life, but the debt needs repayment.

3.title: Science Snobs
3.plot: Two academics lament the lack of creativity in the science fair exhibits and generally take it all too seriously.

4.title: Trophy
4.plot: A double-date is in uneasy waters because the ladies have disappeared into the ladies room and the guys wonder what could be going on and if it might have to do with an off-hand comment.

5.title: Gayguls
5.plot: While at a mall food court, the guys contemplate an upcoming school reunion and the merits of concerning yourself with what other people think.

6.title: Handy Man
6.plot: One guy is over being in "the scene" and just wants to find love, but his younger friend still hopes to reap the rewards of popularity.

7.title: Jumping Jeremy Jack Russell
7.plot: Two confused would be crooks are trapped in a weird situation and want nothing to get out of it, but things are different that what they seem to be.

8.title: We Need to Talk
8.plot: It's this couple's one-year anniversary and if they are going to continue being married, they need to sort a few things out.

9.title: New Kind of High
9.plot: Two cousins discuss the pros and cons of coming together for family reunions versus holidays. They also ponder over dating and a replacement for hard living.

10.title: Not So Easy A
10.plot: It's graduation day and it''ll be tough for this kid to walk with his class when there's a final report due, but it's not written yet. Some tough love from the teacher and a little help from dad. An "A" is going to be pretty hard to get.

11.title: Ferry Game
11.plot: This guy knows how to loosen up on the commute to work and let go of your troubles when the work day is done.

12.title: Bingo Bango
12.plot: Two friends discuss bingo, growing old, and final wishes as they wait for the fish and chips to be served at the retirement home.

13.title: Mom's Recipe
13.plot: Two brothers, both running in their own way, reunite on a hunting trip after years of being apart. They try to come to terms with their fear, shame, and regret while also forgiving each other.

14.title: See No Knievel
14.plot: Stuntman Tim Gareth didn't land his latest stunt and is in the hospital again. His son, Tim Jr. has come to visit and give an ultimatum.

15.title: Parade and Masquerade
15.plot: Parades are fun, especially when you know someone in it. When your husband's the King but you're not the Queen it's different. Everyone copes differently with difficult relationships and the worst lies are the ones we tell ourselves.

16.title: Turbulant
16.plot: Flying in a small plane is always a little spooky. A little turbulence can get you thinking about your life, your career, and your future. It's about to get bumpy.

17.title: Dirty Birdy
17.plot: A wealthy couple decide to take the car on vacation without the help and decide to slum it a little...like when they were kids.

18.title: Stand Up and Represent
18.plot: It's open-mic night and there's tension when our budding comic seeks representation.

19.title: Nailing It Down
19.plot: Getting back into the club scene after almost a decade away is made easier if you have a smooth operator to be your guide. They can find the girls, but can they find love?

20.title: Peace Be With You
20.plot: Season finale. Things get tense when Pastor John inserts himself into a marriage by giving a couple some free tickets for a sunrise concert in the park so they can talk about their troubles, which is news to one of them.

1.title: Life's a Gamble
1.plot: You win some and you lose some some, and sometimes you lose more than you bargained for. If you just keep working the system, you're bound to be okay in the end, right?

2.title: The Waffler
2.plot: It's getting late in his presidential campaign and even little mistakes could sink Governor Peabody's bid. The campaign manager, James, is there to help with damage control, but can a distraction tactic get them back on track?

3.title: KFC
3.plot: Dedicated father and grateful son come together to have a BBQ. While they're at it, they talk about a childhood thought too good to be true by a scared kid in foster care.

4.title: Carny-Ville
4.plot: An county fair attendee gets more info than he bargained for when a Ferris-wheel carny gives him the low-down on what does and doesn't happen in the seedy world of the traveling carnival.

5.title: Burnin' Love
5.plot: After some drunken fire dancing goes wrong, our couple recover in the hospital and wrestle with the passions that got them in trouble, and brought them together in the first place.

6.title: Get Your Kicks
6.plot: Regulars usually expect special treatment, but the service at this shoe store is not what this regular had in mind. Going the extra mile or crossing the line, you decide.

7.title: Pâté and Liverwurst
7.plot: Two friends go on a road trip to catch up and talk out their worries, but how will you act when it's clear that your friend has out-grown you.

8.title: D'Evolution
8.plot: Looking backward is a wondrous and terrible thing. Past glory and past pain are inextricably connected. In a fast moving world, ideas and sensitivities move faster than people do.

9.title: Logical Phallusy
9.plot: HR has a difficult job to do and barely enough authority to do it. Derrick and Garrett navigate the delicate fringes of their authority and pick winners and losers in their quest to help work that bottom line.

10.title: That's Tow Business
10.plot: Freddy has a beef with the wife and he's going to extremes to show her what's what and his barber discusses his motives and old verses new with the kids these days.

11.title: The Badass
11.plot: The old chestnut question of the jail cell; "Wha'cha in for?" brings puffery, conceit, and silliness. Quin and "Old Doc" discuss the finer points of what being a badass is...and isn't.

12.title: Deal Breakers
12.plot: Father and son take a shvitz and use the opportunity to discuss the finer points of selecting a mate and being true to yourself...literally.

13.title: Hai Karate
13.plot: Freddy and Rocco are back at the employment office to pick up their unemployment check and some new job leads. Their perfect job is out there somewhere, but getting it could be a trick.

14.title: Loophole
14.plot: The I.R.S. can be pretty in-your-face, but this over jealous auditor will stop at nothing to perform repeated annual audits of this family company. Well...there is something.

15.title: Candy Ass
15.plot: A Girl Scout taffy pull is a great place to be helpful, get some exercise, and hang out. It's extra fun when you find a way to find common interests and learn some embarrassing secrets.

16.title: Table Whine
16.plot: Dining with the boss can be hit or miss, but it can give you a good idea of who it is you work for and what you can expect going forward. Keep your bearings and one eye out for opportunity because it could be right behind you.

17.title: Current Life Regression
17.plot: It's fun to go to the Fortune-teller and hear what might have been and what could be, but it's also important to live your life now as well.

18.title: Re-Gift Rap
18.plot: The holidays are filled with joy, anxiety and avarice. Some enjoy it more than others, but having a job at all is always a bonus. Well, maybe not always a bonus.

19.title: Break It Off
19.plot: Digestion problems are no joke, but one can use the time to ponder your choices and what you want from life, and that may include more hot wings, just not right now.

20.title: Cast Even
20.plot: Nothing changes a man like the birth of his first child, and no man is ever prepared, or thinks they. Providing for a child is his obligation and noblest goal. Be sure when giving everything, you also give the most important thing.

1.title: Time to Shine
1.plot: It's the END OF THE WORLD, but these backwater boys are going into their last day with heads high and minds on what will soon come to be...well, that and a little white lightning. When facing death, it's a time to whine, or a time to shine.

2.title: Flak
2.plot: When every mission could be the last, you learn everything about your plane and yourself as well, but it's easier not knowing too much about the kid next to you. Becoming jaded is easy when you you've seen and delivered so much death.

3.title: Drive Thru It
3.plot: Grabbing some grub with Pops would be fine if he wasn't hoping you might have a "special bonding moment". Sometimes if you give the old man a chance, a moment might just happen anyway.

4.title: Digging Up Bones
4.plot: When you die and all your belongings are carted out to be sold, some light could find it's way to to the dark places and your secrets may not stay secret. If folks come around digging, they may find bones.

5.title: Dorfus Reborn
5.plot: Fantasy fiction has it's fans, but it's a daring experiment to first illustrate a beloved character in the fourth book. Of course, there are always repercussions to face.

6.title: FroYo BOGO
6.plot: A small Philly suburb is dealing with their homeless problem. Cleaning up the neighborhood brings opportunity, but, you need to look at all angles, and make sure you're clear about what your motivations really are.

7.title: The Little Shvitz
7.plot: It's nice to take time to relax, and the conversation dances between the changing face of satire and the sensibilities of the next generation. Passing on the wisdom and folly of bygone generations is not for the weak of heart.

8.title: Meme-Worthy
8.plot: It's not unusual for embarrassing things to happen, but when it's caught on the Kiss-Cam at a nationally televised NBA game, it's a game-changer. Can there be a bright side, or you ever live it down?

9.title: Hero Complex
9.plot: Heroes are all around us and most never intended to be heroes, but some do. It takes a special kind of person to be a fire-fighter, but some want more.

10.title: Blood Brothers
10.plot: When family secrets are revealed, two brothers find their bond is more than skin deep.

11.title: Phoenix Claws
11.plot: Trying new things can be scary and sometimes even trying, but there are often rewards beyond just the experience...and you never know who's watching.

12.title: Dark Horse
12.plot: In horse racing, there's no such thing as a sure bet. Odds are stacked against these two as they navigate a world where the stakes are life-changing.

13.title: Date and Switch
13.plot: Getting to know someone takes time. If you want to make a real connection, you'll have to let your walls down so they can see the real you.

14.title: Mani-Pause
14.plot: It's never good to jump to conclusions, but when the teacher feels it's very important to have both parents present for this particular bit of news, you can't help but wonder what this is really about.

15.title: Old Faithful
15.plot: Silence is not necessarily golden, and when we do talk, it's important to be heard. It takes a lot of give and take to make a marriage last and it's not fair if all the give is on one side and the take on the other.

16.title: Outbound and Down
16.plot: If your outbound sales job is on the way out, it's much easier to talk about the things that changed your point of view and made it impossible to continue down the path you've been on. You might even get your friend to reconsider it too.

17.title: A Better View
17.plot: When you're out there living your life, you never know who's paying attention. As humble as it may be, sometimes your lawn has the greener grass.

18.title: Culver's Redemption
18.plot: Keeping a series fresh without getting boring is always a trick and knowing the history of your industry can be a double-edged sword. Even still, when the ideas are flowing, you go with it.

19.title: Truth or Dared
19.plot: Jonathan thought his wife could handle an art class with a live nude model, but instead, he learns a lot about her turn-ons and hang-ups.

20.title: Half-Cleansed
20.plot: Season finale. Fredrick has joined a new spiritual group and they do things a bit differently than he's used to, but before he can receive his spiritual name, he must be cleansed.

imdb.title: Anthill Improv
plot: With a suggestion for a situation that brings people together, the players make up a 10-20 minute scene on the spot. Some scenes are funny and some are quite serious, but ultimately the goal is to be grounded, genuine, and honest.::Antonio Lexerot
